meanings.definition: A hose used to spray water or other extinguishing agents to put out fires.
meanings.sent1: The firefighters quickly grabbed the firehoses to put out the blazing fire.
meanings.sent2: The fire department always carries firehoses on their trucks for emergencies.
meanings.sent3: When the firehoses started dancing in the wind, it looked like a water show.
meanings.sent4: The firehoses became like heroes, saving the building from destruction.
meanings.sent5: The bright red firehoses snaked through the smoke, bringing hope to the trapped residents.

meanings.definition: To spray with a firehose to extinguish a fire.
meanings.sent1: The firefighters will firehoses the flames until they are completely out.
meanings.sent2: Please firehoses the area to prevent the fire from spreading.
meanings.sent3: He accidentally firehoses his friend while trying to put out the campfire.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like a powerful firehose, extinguishing all doubts in his mind.
meanings.sent5: The teacher firehoses the students with knowledge, helping them grow and learn.
